intro: Acianthera duartei, commonly known as the Duarte's orchid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in Brazil, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive lip-shaped petal. It is often found growing on trees or rocks in dense forests, showcasing its epiphytic nature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
